content: inner beast the crazy yarn challenge by sharon maher laughing purple goldfish designs meet your inner beast that voice from within which fills you with doubts… makes you question your decisions your happiness and your ability to succeed he s a nameless faceless creature and he needs to be tamed pinch him poke him throw him across the room scream at him jump on him bite him on the butt i promise you… he won t feel a thing inner beast - by sharon maher of laughing purple goldfish designs ©2017 yarn used special stitches 4 seasons marvel 8ply dk 100% acrylic adjustable magic_ring amr 60g/170m 2 1oz/186yds  make a loop of yarn by wrapping in a clockwise direction around two fingers mc fuschia #1068 1 ball on the left hand  pinch the point where the yarn meets crazy yarn assorted yarns knotted together between the thumb and forefinger  slide fingers out so that the ring can 170m 186yds be used  place crochet hook into the centre of small quantity dk white yarn the ring and pull a loop of the working yarn through - this is the starting point for the round  work as the pattern instructs for the notions remainder of the round - all stitches are worked around both the ring and 3 mm crochet hook us c or d the tail  when completed the beginning tail 5 mm crochet hook us 8 can be pulled tight thus closing the ring wool needle invisible decrease invdec stitch marker  put hook through the front loop polyfill stuffing 200g only of the next stitch  then bring the hook back to the front buttons 2 for eyes of your work again this time put it through the front loop only of the following stitch try to ignore the fact that it feels a little awkward finished size  you should now have three stitches on your hook toy stands 28 cm 11 in tall  yo pull through 2 loops yo again pull through remaining two loops gauge gauge tip exact gauge is not important but stuffing in the finished doll should not be visible between when using crazy yarn the stitch detail your stitches is not highly visible if necessary change the hook size to suit your gauge instead of the invisible decrease you may prefer to use a more simple decrease method such as decrease abbreviations standard us abbreviations are used inner beast - by sharon maher of laughing purple goldfish designs ©2017 pattern notes the body of the doll is worked in the round from the base up the head is worked in the round from the top down all other pieces are attached to the main body the knots and loose ends from the crazy yarn will fall to the back of your work the sample shown has the reverse side of the stitches facing the outside of the toy for added interest all pieces are worked in
